A B C D F G I J N O P S U

A

AccumulatedAverageKbPerSecondCalculator - Interface in org.greencheek.processio.service.usage
Given a starting time in the past and a current timestamp, and given the number representing the amount of bytes used by the process between those two times; the implementing class will work out the amount of Kb (Kilobytes) per second that equates to.

B

BasicProcessIOUsage - Class in org.greencheek.processio.service.usage
This implementation uses both DifferenceInKBPerSecondCalculator and AccumulatedAverageKbPerSecondCalculator to return to the caller the amount of io that has been processed between two sample dates, and also since a certain given time (usually the start of the process) User: dominictootell Date: 22/04/2012 Time: 13:46

DifferenceInKBPerSecondCalculator - Interface in org.greencheek.processio.service.usage
Given two sets of data: A time The amount of bytes used by the process at that time period The two sets of data vary such that one set represents the amount of data used at that time period, previous to the amount of bytes used at the time period in the future presented by the second data set Given the sets of data the implementing class will return in kb (kilobytes), per second, the amount of io that has occurred between the two time periods User: dominictootell Date: 22/04/2012 Time: 09:34

getCurrentWriteBytes() - Method in class org.greencheek.processio.domain.CurrentProcessIO

getDifferenceInKbPerSecond(long, long, long, long) - Method in interface org.greencheek.processio.service.usage.DifferenceInKBPerSecondCalculator
Returns the amount of io, in kb per second, that has occurred between the two given timestamps.
getDifferenceInKbPerSecond(long, long, long, long) - Method in class org.greencheek.processio.service.usage.PrimitiveBasedDifferenceInKBPerSecondCalculator
Given two sets of data: A time The amount of bytes used by the process at that time period The two sets of data vary such that one set represents the amount of data used at that time period, previous to the amount of bytes used at the time period in the future presented by the second data set Given the sets of data the implementing class will return in kb (kilobytes), per second, the amount of io that has occurred between the two time periods A prerequisite is that the previousTimeStamp by less than the currentTimeStamp
getDifferenceInReadBytes() - Method in class org.greencheek.processio.domain.ProcessIO
Returns the difference in read bytes between the previous time stamp and the current time stamp
getDifferenceInWriteBytes() - Method in class org.greencheek.processio.domain.ProcessIO
Returns the difference in write bytes between the previous time stamp and the current time stamp
getKbPerSecond(long, long, long) - Method in interface org.greencheek.processio.service.usage.AccumulatedAverageKbPerSecondCalculator
Returns the amount of kb per second has been processed/performed between the two time stamps
getKbPerSecond(long, long, long) - Method in class org.greencheek.processio.service.usage.PrimitiveBasedAccumulatedAverageKBPerSecondCalculator

N

NON_READABLE_PROCESS_IO - Static variable in interface org.greencheek.processio.service.io.ProcessIOReader
Represents that the IO for the current process could not be read/obtained

O

org.greencheek.processio.agent - package org.greencheek.processio.agent
This package contains the JavaAgent that kicks of the process of monitoring /proc/PID/io
for the amount of IO that is being performed by the current JVM process.
org.greencheek.processio.domain - package org.greencheek.processio.domain
Stores the domain model objects that represent: CurrentProcessIO : Used to store temporarily the current io that has been obtain for the current process ProcessIO : Used to store the previous IO that has been recorded for the process, and the latest IO that has been recorded for the process
org.greencheek.processio.domain.jmx - package org.greencheek.processio.domain.jmx
Contains the MXBean that is stored in the JMX Server, to obtain the ProcessIO obtain from the JMX Service as an atomic unit.
org.greencheek.processio.service.io - package org.greencheek.processio.service.io
Contains the classes that obtain the current read and write io for the given process.
org.greencheek.processio.service.persistence - package org.greencheek.processio.service.persistence
Contains the implementation that stores the current processes io into jmx.
org.greencheek.processio.service.persistence.jmx - package org.greencheek.processio.service.persistence.jmx
Contains the implementation of ProcessIOUsagePersistence that stores the current process's io into jmx.
org.greencheek.processio.service.pid - package org.greencheek.processio.service.pid
Contains implementations that obtain the PID of the currently operating JVM process
org.greencheek.processio.service.scheduler - package org.greencheek.processio.service.scheduler
Contains the implementation of ProcessIOScheduler that stores uses a single threads scheduled executor service that periodically reads the current process's io from a given ProcessIOReader and persists that result IO, if it is valid, using the given implementation of the ProcessIOUsagePersistence interface
org.greencheek.processio.service.usage - package org.greencheek.processio.service.usage
Package that holds the implementations that are responsible for calculating the usage of the current JVM process by querying the ProcessIO object.

ProcessIO(long, long, long, long, long, long) - Constructor for class org.greencheek.processio.domain.ProcessIO
If the ProcessIO object is stored in a Jmx MBean Server, the @ConstructorProperties are used in order to allow a JMX MXBean object to reconstruct the ProcessIO object to map the constructor arguments to match the jmx properties (accessor method) of the object.
ProcessIOAgent - Class in org.greencheek.processio.agent

ProcessIOUsagePersistence - Interface in org.greencheek.processio.service.persistence
Saves to somewhere, currently the default implementation is JMX, the CurrentProcessIO that the process has performed (accumulated value) since the process started.

S

ScheduledExecutorServiceProcessIOScheduler - Class in org.greencheek.processio.service.scheduler
Uses a single threaded executor service the contains a runnable task that simply: calls ProcessIOReader.getCurrentProcessIO() asks for the resulting CurrentProcessIO to be persisted by the implementation of ProcessIOUsagePersistence The CurrentProcessIO is only requested to be persisted if is not the ProcessIOReader.NON_READABLE_PROCESS_IO instance User: dominictootell Date: 22/04/2012 Time: 18:38

setProcessIO(CurrentProcessIO) - Method in class org.greencheek.processio.domain.jmx.ProcessIOUsageHolder
Updates the ProcessIO object reference to contain a new reference to a ProcessIO object that has been populated with new read and write io information from the given CurrentProcessIO object.

U

updateCurrentValues(CurrentProcessIO) - Method in class org.greencheek.processio.domain.ProcessIO
Given the current amount of IO that the process has been recorded as caused, This will return a new ProcessIO object with the previous (this object's) current io values , as the previous values, and the values in the given CurrentProcessIO object as the most recent, current, values.
updateCurrentValues(long, long, long) - Method in class org.greencheek.processio.domain.ProcessIO
Given the current amount of IO that the process has been recorded as caused, This will return a new ProcessIO object with the previous (this object's) current io values , as the previous values, and the values in the given as the most recent, current, values.
